Author: Molly Andrasik
Body:
Email sent to [~bzsenits], [~D311808], [~D342669], [~L344128], [~L329678] on 10/24 at 8:45am 
 
Good morning, everyone -
 
Yesterday at OSC we did not get much time to discuss the C. auris dashboard SWIFT, so wanted to have a conversation via email to confirm the urgency of this request and next steps.
 
The team has met with Operations, and internally, to come up with a Design proposal. Tracy can certainly speak more eloquently to this than I can, but essentially the team is proposing a two-wave approach: 
 
Wave 1 - 40 hours of work, so can remain in the SWIFT process 
 * Real-Time Admitted Patients Dashboard 
 ** Built from Reporting Workbench components
 ** Facility-level summary of admitted C. auris patients.
 ** Infection vs. colonization status.
 ** Medically Ready for Discharge (MRD) counts and discharge barriers.
 ** Drill-down detail for MRD patients with device-related barriers.

Wave 2 - 100+ hours of work, so would need to be submitted as a Resource Request 
 * Trending and Community Dashboard 
 ** Built from Cogito Radar Metrics, Clarity or Caboodle TBD by developer.
 ** Historical and current counts of flagged C. auris patients.
 ** Surveillance status and follow-up needs (post-discharge).
 ** Community vs. Hospital Acquired.
 ** Pending and completed lab results for flagged patients system-wide.

 * Add pending lab results for admitted patients to the Real-Time Admitted Patients Dashboard from Wave 1. 

 
Additional details of the Design proposal can be found here: [SWIFT-7458 Design|https://confluence-prd.rochesterregional.org/spaces/SDTES/pages/243499050/SWIFT-7458+-+Create+a+C.+auris+dashboard+to+monitor+current+patients+across+the+system+with+a+c.+auris+diagnosis]
 
At this time, the Design is complete and just needs signing off from Operations. If we can get that, we can add SWIFT-7458, which represents Wave 1 described above, to the November release (likely with a few adjustments to what is already there). 
 
Please review and let us know if this is an acceptable path forward, as this came from an Incident Command situation. In the meantime, we will work to get time set up with Operations to discuss with them as well.
 
Tracy, Evan, Venu, please let me and the group know if I've missed or misrepresented anything! 
 
Thanks!
Molly
 
*Design meeting scheduled for 10/28 at 3:30 pm.*

Author: Venugopal Mudgundi
Body: [~tgrann], [~m328246] [~e34425]. The end users approved the proposed design. Wave 1- 40 hrs worth of work was determined to be able to be completed as a part of this SWIFT, while the rest was to be tackled by an RR later. So this is not to be converted to RR, this is to get the Wave-1 done and then submit a separate RR for the Wave-2 work. Do i capture that appropriately?

Author: Molly Andrasik

I will then change the Idea to Ready for Development. [~t275735], as discussed at OSC, we may need to shift something in the November release in order to add this Development to it.

A1c and HTN should remain in the Swift/RFC process since it sounds like they're currently in design and then can stay on their Nov timeline.

Author: Molly Andrasik
Body:
Email to Dr. Ryan, Jean Marie, and Tracy:
 
Thanks, Dr. Ryan! The apps teams discussed this morning and decided on the following approach:

SWIFT-4852 will be moved out of the October release. 
 * For the November release, this will go back to Design. 
 * Michelle L. indicated that when she met with the team to review the build that was completed, there were some changes requested. With this Design phase, all of that can be ironed out. Additionally, it will provide time for Operations to complete the procedure documentation, competencies, and education.

 * Throughout November, we will continue evaluating progress and determine if the build can also be moved to PRD during that release. If not, the DEV would likely occur during the December release.

Author: Jack Jarvis
Body:
[~SKESSLER] [~ejacob] [~pcabral] 

Interfaces is wondering...

-will these providers' data come into Care Connect via our standard interface from MSOW?

-if so, will their Care Connect PROVID be included?

Current interface design from MSOW to Care Connect: We discard any transactions for which there is no NPI OR Epic Prov ID in the message from MSOW.

Author: Erik Jacob
Body:
Manual entry of the provider as LRP?  Do these all start in MSOW?

 

Interface activity may be to understand the impact of implementing the extension in Epic on how the NPI field also represents the OHIP value for Canadian providers.

Author: Paul Cabral
Body:
Remember the solution we are trying to solve.  Patient walks in with a req for bloodwork or radiology test from their doctor in canada.  

 

This would be no different than a person from florida walking into our laboratory services, and getting blood work for a doctor in florida.  (The only difference is the provider is from Canada who has a special identification number  (not an NPI))

Author: Kessler, Susan
Body: Yes, these Providers are all manually entered into MSOW, by CC Security if comes from any user other than the Lab.  The Lab does the bulk of them.  There is an issue about this however as the demographic information is not always current and there is no process in place to verify info.   The Lab does try to do some, but it's not perfect and could potentially be a HIPAA violation.  CC Security nor the Lab have the capacity to make these verifications, it would be a FT job.

Author: Paul Cabral
Body: [~SKESSLER] - Currently we believe that IVanti has a form to add a new provider. Since Canadian doctors have a different number other than NPI.  Do you want a new form for canadian doctors, or modify current form?

Author: Garret Dieffenbacher
Body:
h3. *Meeting Notes*

*Date:* October 21, 2025
*Attendees:* Christian, Tiffany, Josh, Ian-Shika

*Discussion Summary:*
 * Reviewed the initial design plan for a SmartPhrase incorporating embedded SDE records.
 * Identified a major concern: the current design would require reporting tools to search across all patient records in the system, which could significantly impact system memory and performance.
 * A new order-based approach was proposed as a potential alternative.
 * AMB will explore possible solutions in collaboration with BI partners to ensure reporting efficiency and system stability.

*Next Steps:*
 * AMB to investigate technical feasibility of the proposed order-based solution.
 * BI team to assess reporting implications and provide input on system impact.

Met with the BI and AMB teams, including each team's Epic TS. We discussed potential solutions, and Peter Wang (AMB TS) suggested that the SDEs could be built with an encounter context, which would significantly improve reporting capabilities.

The BI team requested that Peter further investigate any additional Epic recommendations. Once Peter completes his follow-up, we plan to reconvene with our operational partners to finalize the design.

[~m328246] and [~LYOGIS]  - The build was completed based on the 2024 guidelines that were attached to the request. I met with several members from the ASP group last Thursday including Dr. Laguio and it was determined that guidelines had changed somewhat again and there is a stronger desire to push Paxlovid in more patients as opposed to remdesivir to save money and time, where appropriate. 

Due to that, the build needs to be updated and is being reviewed by ASP and pharmacy to ensure there are no other updates that need to be taken into account. 

Once those updates are built, the order set will need to go in front of the ASP group for final approval, which is held towards the end of each month.

Author: Ryan Pacleb
Body:
Last week, we had our first call. From my side, I believe I understood what’s needed to finalize the design from the interface perspective. After the call, a few questions came up on my end, which I sent to the group, and I’m currently waiting for a reply. Below is the list of questions I shared—some of which have already been answered by Nicholas.

Questions:
 # What is the workflow for LAB RedDraw? Who is responsible for performing it?
 # From our call, it was mentioned that the Laboratory results sometimes come without an order number from CareConnect. Does this mean the specimen or sample collection was done without an order? Why does this happen?
 # If this action is permitted, how does the Laboratory obtain patient information and print labels without a link to patient data in CareConnect for the patient encounter or CSN?
 # How does the Laboratory handle specimens outside the ED setting?
 # What are the workflows to ensure patient information is available without an order from CareConnect?
 # How does the Lab verify that these results correspond to the correct patient?
 # How do they determine which ORDER CSN to assign to the result?
 # Within the ED Narrator or ED Track Board, what options do we have to populate this information correctly?
 # From our discussion, I understand that when a laboratory result corresponds to a procedure included in the redraw procedure list provided by LIS, we should populate *OBR-25* with {*}‘I’ (In-Process){*}. This status then flows through to [ORD-90 or ORD-115|#ORD-90 or ORD-115.]. Could you please clarify how this status is presented to care providers in the Emergency Department? Specifically, is it visible in the *ED Narrator* or *ED Track Board.*

Author: Ryan Pacleb
Body: [~LYOGIS] and [~m328246] , it’s true that I will create an SLG, but I can’t move forward until the questions I asked the group are answered.

Author: Chad Caccamise
Body: [~LYOGIS] [~R328168][~P358138] Ryan - do we need to get answer to all your questions before we can complete the design?  We will have to reach out to hospitals.  The Nurses manage all specimen redraws at most hospitals.

Author: Ryan Pacleb
Body:
[~CCACCAMISE] Nicholas have already answered questions 1 to 6, while Lauren addressed questions 7 and 8. It would be great if you could add more information so we can include it in our design.

 
Key Questions & Answers:
 
1.      What is the workflow for LAB RedDraw? Who is responsible for performing it?
 
   • The original test (that was ordered in Epic by the provider) was canceled in LIS because it cannot be performed. The cancellation reason is documented on the LIS order #.
 
   •  Replacement order(s) are created on a new LIS order # (The 8-character number that starts with a letter, as you saw during the meeting). These replacement orders will generate an SN message being sent to Epic.  When this occurs, there is no existing order in Epic for this new order to attach to.
 
 
2.      In our call yesterday, it was mentioned that the Laboratory results sometimes come without an order number from CareConnect. Does this mean the specimen or sample collection was done without an order? Why does this happen?
 
   • The original test is canceled in LIS (with documented reason), and replacement orders generate new LIS order numbers without existing matching orders in EPIC.
 
 
3.      If this action is permitted, how does the Laboratory obtain patient information and print labels without a link to patient data in CareConnect for the patient encounter or CSN?
 
   • All of the patient information exists in these newly created orders in LIS (which are attached to the same CSN, which LIS refers to as a Billing #).
 
 
4.      How does the Laboratory handle specimens outside the ED setting?
 
   • All inpatient redraws are handled the same way.
 
 
5.      What are the workflows to ensure patient information is available without an order from CareConnect? How does the Lab verify that these results correspond to the correct patient?
 
   • Patient and order info are stored in LIS orders linked by CSN.
 
 
6.      How do they determine which ORDER CSN to assign to the result?
 
   • Patient and order info are stored in LIS orders linked by CSN.
 
 
7.      Within the ED Narrator or ED Track Board, what options do we have to populate this information correctly?
 
   • The nursing narrator filters orders based on ORD-90; we have the option to set which statuses are included, but it does not allow for no value, so orders without ORD-90 are never displayed to the nurses, which is impacting the redraw requests. ORD-115 does not impact the narrator as far as we know and was not part of the request
 
 
8.      From our call, I understand that if a laboratory result corresponds to a procedure listed in the redraw procedure list you will provide, we need to populate OBR-25 with ‘I’ (in-process). This, in turn, populates ORD-90 or ORD-115. Could you please clarify how this status is displayed to care providers in the ED? Specifically, is it visible via the ED Narrator or the ED Track Board?
 
   • We don’t want to handle redraw requests separately or in a special manner; we just want them to show up where any other new collection/order would be displayed. The reason for the focus on redraws is that these are currently broken.

Author: Ryan Pacleb
Body:
I wanted to provide a quick update on the Sherlock ticket I opened for the “Lab Redraw Needed” flag project on the ED track board.

My TS connected with Robert Erhardt (OTx TS) regarding the order status question I raised. Here’s the reply:

“Hey Ryan, I spent some time talking with Robert about this one - it sounds like order status is probably not the way to go. One option that would be consistent with how the ED does collection today would be to send the new orders through order transmittal and generate a collection task for the nurses that way. The incoming interface doesn't do this by default, but we can turn it on via TRIGGER_OTX and TRIGGER_OTX_OPTIONS=3-New Orders.

The issue with turning on OTx is that it's going to start running it for all orders created by the interface. I'm seeing a lot of traffic for POCT glucose and micro tests that are following the same SN/NA pattern, and we might not want to send those orders through OTx. Can we clarify with Soft all of the scenarios where they are placing new orders in Soft? We're probably going to need to do some testing and tweaking to get this right. The interface has very little flexibility - it either calls OTx or it doesn't. Anything beyond that, and we need the OTx rules to handle things.”

Author: Molly Andrasik
Body:
[~R328168] - who, specifically, needs to do the follow-up you outlined above? Is it an LIS task? FYI, [~P358138] 

FYI [~C310632]

Author: Ryan Pacleb
Body:
@Molly 

This morning, I sent an email including my TS and Chad C. regarding potential workarounds in Soft and Epic. My original email asked:
 * *Soft:* Is there a way to add a flag if the result message is a redraw? This would allow us to specifically identify redraw messages.

 * *Epic:* One potential, though not ideal, solution is turning on {{TRIGGER_OTX}} with {{{}TRIGGER_OTX_OPTIONS=3-New Orders{}}}. The challenge here is that it would run for all orders created by the interface.

 * Could OTx generate a flag on messages triggered by a Soft redraw so we could filter these in Rhapsody and prevent them from being sent downstream?

Chad responded with the following:
 * Without any lab process/workflow changes the Rhap logic would have to be multi layered in order to tease out just the Soft Initiated orders that are specific to ‘Lab Redraws’

 ** 99% of the Orders that originate in Soft ({_}unsolicited orders sent from Soft{_} _à_ \{_}CC{_}) are not Lab Redraw Orders
 ** {_}What the Rhap logic might look like{_}{_}:{_}  Patient Class is ED + patient has a canceled lab test on that visit + lab placed a “prob code” order on visit + lab placed a new order for the test that was cancelled = if all true send a redraw flag to the track board
There is nothing unique about a Lab Redraw order in the HL7 message.  

*Next Steps:*

 ** We are going to check with the labs to see if they would be willing to alter their workflow
 ** {_}The Idea{_}:  all labs add a “redraw” comment or order to any test that needs to be re-order an ED and Rhap would fire on that??
 * The unfortunate part is that this would be a lab workflow driven solution ({_}human error could contribute to tests not flagging{_})

I have updated the Sherlock ticket I opened this morning. Our TS has not yet responded. Given these challenges, the *Oct 27 design deadline is not achievable* for this project. We are still exploring alternative workarounds to meet our objectives.

Author: Ryan Pacleb
Body:
New update from Robert Erhardt on the SLG# 10531142.
 
Discussed during ASAP call on 10/28. * Robert -

What determines if the order shows in 'Orders to be Acknowledged'?
 * 
 ** Show in Cerner bridge - reprint the labels from there
 * What EAP is being used for the Lab Redraw?
 ** Some cases the original EAP comes back
 ** Some times specific component
 ** Assuming it can be setup to show in 'Orders to be Acknowledged'
 * OTX may be overkill in this case – we are only generating a completion task, so if we can get it to show in orders to be acknowledged that would be best (from there things could be done outside of Epic)

Author: Chad Caccamise
Body: [~C310632] [~LYOGIS]  There is going to be a meeting scheduled with Nick Donato, John Landry and Ryan Pacleb.   _What we need to proof of concept_:  Today when the lab needs a redraw they place the new order -  that new order generates a HL7 'SN' message sent from soft.  That SN message need to be a trigger to add a flag to the ED tracker (when you see this message type and the pt type is ED add a flag). If a new sample is not needed for the for the New Orders the lab will collect/receive that new order and this will generate an "SC" message and that message will remove the test from the tracker (sometimes the labs add new orders and just run those off of samples they already have in the lab).

Author: Garret Dieffenbacher
Body:
*Meeting Notes*

*Date:* November 4, 2025
*Attendees:* Dr. Cabral, Krista Carson, Erik Jacob, Garret Dieffenbacher, Valerie Lonville, Andrew Krawic, Craig Hauber
*Topic:* Creation and Implementation of a Multidisciplinary Note Type in Epic

 

*Discussion Summary*
 * *New Note Type Request*
 * The team discussed the development of a *multidisciplinary note type* within Epic.
 * The goal is to make this note type accessible to all users via a *single drop-down menu* for selecting note types in the ambulatory setting.


 * *Functionality Requirements*
 * Current system does *not support* selecting multiple note types from one location.
 * To meet this need, *new functionality must be enabled* in Epic.
 * Enabling this feature will {*}disable existing Notewriter templates{*}, which will need to be {*}converted to speed buttons{*}.
 * This change will have a {*}system-wide impact{*}.


 * *Communication & Considerations*
 * An email outlining the implications of enabling the new functionality was sent to *Dr. Cabral and Krista* for review.
 * *Andrew Krawic* raised concerns about downstream effects:
 * Close encounter validations
 * Letters
 * SmartPhrases
 * Any workflows that pull in notes may not recognize the new note type initially.


 * *Implementation Approach*
 * Dr. Cabral requested a minimal viable produce approach:
 * Initially implement just the {*}note type in the drop-down menu{*}.
 * Additional functionality and integration will be built out in future phases.

Author: Garret Dieffenbacher
Body:
As noted in the previous meeting summary, enabling access to the new note type will require activating additional functionality. While this enhancement allows users to select different note types from a centralized location, it comes with a significant drawback: users will lose access to all of their existing note writer templates.


This issue must be resolved before we can finalize and approve the design.


Two emails sent to design team for discussion.

Author: Garret Dieffenbacher
Body:
h3. *Meeting Notes: DXR Storage Discussion*

*Date:* 11/5/25
*Attendees:* Andrew Krawic, Judy Kelly, Diana Adam-Podgornik, Ethan Bruha, Bernetha Walker, Erik Jacobs, Paul Cabral, Craig Hauber, Garret Dieffenbacher
----
*Topic:* DXR Storage Strategy

*Discussion Summary:*
 * The team met to address concerns regarding long-term DXR data storage.
 * Consensus was reached to *archive* older DXR data rather than delete it.
 ** This approach allows for querying and temporary restoration of archived data when needed.

*Action Items:*
 # *Legal Review:*

 ** _Owner:_ Diana Adam-Podgornik
 ** _Task:_ Confirm lookback requirements—10 years (RRH) vs. 7 years (NYS)—with the legal team.
 # *Infrastructure Approval:*

 ** _Owner:_ Erik Jacobs
 ** _Task:_ Initiate conversations to obtain approval for server work, additional hardware, and associated costs resulting from the archiving decision.
 # *CER Rule Configuration:*

 ** _Task:_ Use CER rules to apply different lookback periods based on patient class, depending on legal guidance.

Author: Molly Andrasik
Body:
From [~B358296]:

I met with Stephanie and Venu this afternoon, to go over where we are at with SWIFT 6922. Intellidesk is updated now, and MSOW is in the process of being manually updated with the correct data. There is an interface to Epic that should carry the pager data from MSOW -> Epic so that will be in sync as well. We should be able to hit our 10/27 release for this initial sync across all the systems.

Author: Dylan Taft
Body: Reopened design to review BRD + spec after speaking with Jeff.  This may not be doable as the documentation lays out due to it calling out APPs which may not be documented in transactions feeding to premier.  I also need to review the association of baby to mother, and likely I will have to run some findings through a clinical report writer.  This is likely considered "design" - Jeff maybe called out the need for something between design and build - "planning" which could cause something to send back to design.  If research shows this won't work, we will send back to design committee or meet with Evan.  I would rather just meet with Evan than pass a hot potato back and forth when we get to that time, but hours I need to log should be considered design\scope.

Author: Molly Andrasik
Body:
[~DTAFT], [~J303810], [~t275735], [~e34425] 

This Design was complete and signed off on by Operations on 10/15. Now, on 10/24, this Design is being pulled from the October release. Something was missed. All necessary reviews should have happened before the Design was marked as done. 

This was an OSC escalated SWIFT, which [~L329678] indicated needed to be a high priority, so pushing Design to November is really concerning, as that likely means DEV won't be done until the end of December. Unless you think that the remaining Design and Dev can be done in November. 

Please let me know as soon as possible if there is any way to keep this DESIGN in the October release and stay on track.

Author: Joshua Rubin
Body: [~m328246] Yes I've been working on this design for the last few weeks. I was told that this was to be made a top priority and to begin working on this immediately. We can probably add this to the current release since I'm hoping to have the design finalized by the 10/27 deadline.

Author: Molly Andrasik
Body: [~JRUBIN] is this Design complete at this point?

Author: Joshua Rubin
Body: [~m328246] I was hoping to get this done by end of this week, but I don't think that's going to happen. The users requesting this added in changes based on an updated policy for 2026 which added in a large amount of design items we're still trying to determine how to incorporate. Can we move this design to the next release?

Author: Molly Andrasik
Body:
[~JRUBIN], thanks for letting me know. If there is no way to complete this by 10/27, I will push it.

However, moving forward, let's try to front-load the Designs in the release month so we don't run into this again. It sounds like the Design Meetings have been ongoing since September, and your last update was on 10/7. If there was a risk here. I'd like to have known about it sooner than 3 days before the deadline. Additionally, this was not brought up as a risk during our stand-ups, and it sounds like it should have been.

These things are 'lessons learned' moving forward, so we don't have items fall out of the release. 

[~t275735] FYI

Author: Molly Andrasik
Body:
[~JRUBIN] didn't hear back from you, and there wasn't an update on the Stand-Up this morning, so pushing this to the November release. 

[~t275735] FYI

Author: Tina Grann
Body:
[Create and Configure a Telemedicine Visit Type|https://galaxy.epic.com/Redirect.aspx?DocumentID=100130082&PrefDocID=98346]
h3. Create and Configure a Telemedicine Visit Type

To schedule video visits, you need to create a visit type. Epic recommends that you create unified visit types using telehealth mode flags rather than creating separate video visit types for existing visit types in your system. If you've already created visit types for which you need a video visit type, you can reuse the existing visit type if its configuration can generally apply to video visits as well. Refer to the [Set Available Telehealth Modes for Visit Types |https://galaxy.epic.com/Redirect.aspx?DocumentID=100076772]topic for more information about using the telehealth mode flag with new or existing visit types.

Author: Garret Dieffenbacher
Body: Will require design help from Cadence and HI.

Author: Shannon Gaurin
Body:
Shannon Gaurin, Jessica Canton, Mary King, Jamie Conrow, and Pearlie Petty met to discuss design requirements, all in agreement this is specifically a reporting request.
 * Shannon met with Tina to discuss reporting options in the interim, as there is a project in progress to standardize scheduling templates and implement Visit Mode, RR-50254. Go-Live is currently slated for January 2026, the implementation of visit modes will allow for standard reporting functionality based on the select appointment visit mode, i.e. Telephone, In Person, Video Visit.
 * Mary will reach out to request to provide an update.
 * Tina is researching existing reporting options.

Body: Requestor (Janene) Is ok with waiting for the visit mode update to go live for this change
